result.execSummary:
The defendant Angelina M Barson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Upon successful completion of probation and no new violations rising to the level of probable cause.

-Pay supervision fees.
-AODA assessment and follow up.
-Absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs or controlled substances unless prescribed and in accordance with prescription.
-Random tests.

timeConds.notes:
Huber granted.
16 days credit if revoked.

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random tests. 
-Pay supervision fees.

State
State

Defendant Angelina M Barson in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Adam Y Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Scott Nicholson sworn and testified. Officer Gary Belzer sworn and testified. State rests subject to rebuttal. Atty. Wasserman moves to dismiss. Court denies motion. Court finds probable cause and binds case over for trial. State files information. Defense waives reading remains mute as to plea. Court enters not guilty plea on defendant's behalf. Atty. Wassermann motion for bail reduction. Court reduces bail to $1500 cash with same bail conditions.
Preliminary hearing on May 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Angelina M Barson in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Adam Y. Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wasserman requests preliminary hearing date. Atty. Wasserman motion for bail reduction. DA opposes bail reduction. Court will address bail motion on date of preliminary hearing, would like defendant to start attending program. Court will permit defendant to travel to Illinois or Nevada if accompanied by a parent.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Notice of appearance
Status hearing on April 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Angelina M Barson in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed Atty. Wasserman has been retained by defendant, Atty. Laatsch will no longer be representing defendant. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Dejunco.  Counsel states appearing as friend to the Court only today.  Court advises the defendant of the penalties.  Court advises the defendant on right to counsel.  Defendant requesting to contact the public defender.  State requesting $3000 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $3000 cash bail w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed.  Court finds good cause to extend timelimits for holding of the preliminary hearing.  Court orders matter adj to 3/25 at 1:15 pm for status of prelim hrg.
